org.mule.modules.watsonvisualrecognition

Class WatsonVisualRecognitionConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mule.modules.watsonvisualrecognition.WatsonVisualRecognitionConnector

  • @RequiresEnterpriseLicense(allowEval=true)
 @ReconnectOn(exceptions=com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.exception.ServiceUnavailableException.class)
 @Connector(name="watson-visual-recognition",
           friendlyName="Watson Visual Recognition",
           minMuleVersion="3.6.0")
public class WatsonVisualRecognitionConnector
extends Object
    Visual Recognition allows users to understand the contents of an image or video frame, answering the question: “What is in this image?” Submit an image, and the service returns scores for relevant classifiers representing things such as objects, events and settings.
    Author:
    Admios

      • classifyImage

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.VisualClassification classifyImage(@RefOnly @Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                                ClassifyImageRequest request)
        Upload images or URLs to identify built-in classifiers by default. To identify custom classifiers, include the classifier_ids parameters. Images must be in .jpeg, or .png format. API Doc
        Parameters:
        request - Request with all the options for the classify an image operation.
        Returns:
        A list of detected classes in the image.

      • detectFaces

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.DetectedFaces detectFaces(@RefOnly @Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                       ImageRequest request)
        Analyze faces in images and get data about them, such as estimated age and gender. Images must be in .jpeg, or .png format. API Doc
        Parameters:
        request - Request with all the options for the detect faces operation.
        Returns:
        A list of detected faces, his age, gender and position in the image.

      • recognizeText

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.RecognizedText recognizeText(@RefOnly @Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                          ImageRequest request)
        Recognizes text in images. This is a beta function of the Visual Recognition service that supports only English language text identification. API Doc
        Parameters:
        request - Request with all the options for the recognize text operation.
        Returns:
        The text recognized in the image.

      • retrieveListOfClassifiers

        @Processor
public List<com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.VisualClassifier> retrieveListOfClassifiers()
        Retrieve a list of user-created classifiers. API Doc
        Returns:
        A list of classifiers associated with your API Key.

public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.VisualClassifier retrieveClassifierDetails(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                                        String classifierId)
        Retrieve information about a specific classifier. API Doc
        Parameters:
        classifierId - The ID of the classifier for which you want details.
        Returns:

      • deleteClassifier

        @Processor
public void deleteClassifier(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                        String classifierId)
        Delete a custom classifier with the specified classifier ID. API Doc
        Parameters:
        classifierId - The ID of the classifier you want to delete.

      • createClassifier

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.VisualClassifier createClassifier(@RefOnly @Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                               ClassifierRequest request)
                                                                                                        throws VisualRecognitionException
        Train a new multi-faceted classifier on the uploaded image data. A new custom classifier can be trained by several compressed (.zip) files, including files containing positive or negative images (.jpg, or .png). You must supply at least two compressed files, either two positive example files or one positive and one negative example file. API Doc
        Parameters:
        request - Request with all the options for the create classifier operation.
        Returns:
        The classifier that was created.
        Throws:
        VisualRecognitionException - When amount of items inside the zip is less than 10.

      • updateClassifier

        @Processor
public com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.visual_recognition.v3.model.VisualClassifier updateClassifier(@RefOnly @Default(value="#[payload]")
                                                                                                               ClassifierRequest request)
                                                                                                        throws VisualRecognitionException
        Update an existing classifier by adding new classes, or by adding new images to existing classes API Doc
        Parameters:
        request - Request with all the options for the update classifier operation.
        Returns:
        The classifier that was updated.
        Throws:
        VisualRecognitionException - When some of the zip files are empty

      • byteArrayToFile

        @Processor
public File byteArrayToFile(@Default(value="#[payload]")
                                       Object data,
                                       String extension)
                                throws IOException
        Convert an array of bytes into a File object to use it in the other operations.
        Parameters:
        data - The array of byte to convert.
        extension - The extension of the file you want to create.
        Returns:
        return A temporal file with the contend of the byte array.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is any problem creating the temporal file.
        IllegalArgumentException - When the data parameter is not a byte[].
